text.0: impetuous true let maghavan come hither and let his tawny coursers speed to reach us.
text.1: for him have we pressed juice exceeding potent here praised with song let him effect his visit.
text.2: unyoke as at thy journeys end o hero to gladden thee today at this libation.
text.3: like uśanā the priest a laud shall utter a hymn to thee the lord divine who markest.
text.4: when the bull quaffing praises our libation as a sage paying holy rites in secret.
text.5: seven singers here from heaven hath he begotten who een by day have wrought their works while singing.
text.6: when heavens fair light by hymns was made apparent they made great splendour shine at break of morning.
text.7: he with his succour best of heroes scattered the blinding darkness so that men saw clearly.
text.8: indra impetuous one hath waxed immensely he with his vastness hath filled earth and heaven.
text.9: een beyond this his majesty extendeth who hath exceeded all the worlds in greatness.
text.10: Śakra who knoweth well all human actions hath with his eager friends let loose the waters.
text.11: they with their songs cleft een the mountain open and willingly disclosed the stall of cattle.
text.12: he smote away the floods obstructer vṛtra earth conscious lent her aid to speed thy thunder.
text.13: thou sentest forth the waters of the ocean as lord through power and might o daring hero.
text.14: when muchinvoked the waters rock thou cleftest saramā showed herself and went before thee.
text.15: hymned by aṅgirases bursting the cowstalls much strength thou foundest for us as our leader.
text.16: come maghavan friend of man to aid the singer imploring thee in battle for the sunlight.
text.17: speed him with help in his inspired invokings down sink the sorcerer the prayerless dasyu.
text.18: come to our home resolved to slay the dasyu kutsa longed eagerly to win thy friendship.
text.19: alike in form ye both sate in his dwelling the faithful lady was in doubt between you.
text.20: thou comest fain to succour him with kutsaa goad that masters both the windgods horses.
text.21: that holding the brown steeds like spoil for capture the sage may on the final day be present.
text.22: for kutsa with thy thousand thou at daybreak didst hurl down greedy Śuṣṇa foe of harvest.
text.23: quickly with kutsas friend destroy the dasyus and roll the chariotwheel of sūrya near us.
text.24: thou to the son of vidathin Ṛjiśvan gavest up mighty mṛgaya and pipru.
text.25: thou smotest down the swarthy fifty thousand and rentest forts as age consumes a garment.
text.26: what time thou settest near the sun thy body thy form immortal one is seen expanding.
text.27: thou a wild elephant with might invested like a dread lion as thou wieldest weapons.
text.28: wishes for wealth have gone to indra longing for him in war for light and at libation.
text.29: eager for glory labouring with praisesongs he is like home like sweet and fair nutrition.
text.30: call we for you that indra prompt to listen him who hath done so much for mens advantage.
text.31: who lord of envied bounty to a singer like me brings quickly booty worth the capture.
text.32: when the sharppointed arrow o thou hero flieth mid any conflict of the people.
text.33: when faithful one the dread encounter cometh then be thou the protector of our body.
text.34: further the holy thoughts of vamadeva be thou a guileless friend in fight for booty.
text.35: we come to thee whose providence protects us wide be thy sway for ever for thy singer.
text.36: o indra with these men who love thee truly free givers maghavan in every battle.
text.37: may we rejoice through many autumns quelling our foes as days subdue the nights with splendour.
text.38: now as the bhṛgus wrought a car for indra the strong the mighty we our prayer have fashioned.
text.39: that he may neer withdraw from us his friendship but be our bodies guard and strong defender.
text.40: now indra lauded glorified with praises let power swell high like rivers for the singer.
text.41: for thee a new hymn lord of bays is fashioned may we carborne through song be victors ever.
